node.title: Finding you're a bit COVID-19 anxious ahead of Tasmania's border reopening? These tips may help
node.alt: A woman in a face masks holds her head in her hands.
node.description: Life in Tasmania has been relatively normal and lockdown-free this year, so it's no wonder some people are feeling a little anxious about the state's borderÂ reopening in a week's time. So what can you do to ease the concern?
node.content:
["Other than QR code check-ins, some capacity restrictions\u00a0and the odd bit of mask-wearing, life in Tasmania recently has been relatively normal.\u00a0", "That is all about to change, with the state's border\u00a0set to reopen next Wednesday.\u00a0", "For some, unrestricted travel means long overdue family and friend reunions, or a well-deserved holiday.", "But, for others, the idea of open borders is causing some anxiety.\u00a0", "Modelling from the Kirby Institute projects an average of 258 daily cases in Tasmania in the first 200 days after re-opening\u00a0and, if South Australia's recent border easing is anything to go by, there are likely to be cases sooner rather than later.\u00a0", "Hobart counsellor Di Stow said that, while it would be an exciting time for many, it was OK to be feeling a bit worried.\u00a0", "She said people needed to try to\u00a0focus on the positive things that would\u00a0come with the opening, suggesting that \"in itself will build up a good feeling\".", "\"You can talk to your friends about what's going well, what they're looking forward to doing,\" she said.", "", "
Dr Stow said\u00a0being prepared for the reopening was one way to ease anxieties.(ABC News: Mahalia Carter)
", "Dr Stow recommended people\u00a0\"breathe into it\".", "\"How you deal with it is very much an individual thing, and people will cope with anxiety in different ways,\" she said.", "\"Some of the more particular things might be mindfulness and meditation. It might be exercise, routines\u00a0and regimes just like walking, being outdoors.\u00a0", "\"The sorts of things that you might already be doing but maybe being more purposeful about them, [as well as]\u00a0talking to professional people.\"\u00a0", "While borders reopening will be a big change, people can do simple things to ease their concerns, such as remembering to follow public health guidelines, checking into shops and venues, and using hand sanitiser.", "", "
Reminders about following public health guidelines can help reduce concerns.(ABC News: Luke Bowden)
", "\"I'm not wanting to be foreboding and say, 'Oh, gosh, it's going to be way worse'. It's up to us to build our resilience, and choose happiness,\" she said.", "And, while it is understandable for people to be nervous about this next stage, being prepared will make it easier.", "\"For example \u2026\u00a0[if]\u00a0you're about to head off to an event, maybe have a bit of a plan about how you're going to manage yourself\u00a0mask-wise or sanitation-wise\u00a0at that event, and that can actually give you ideas and tips\u00a0and a plan\u00a0so that you're potentially able to decrease anxiety.\"", "For those feeling worried about having potentially prickly conversations with a co-worker,\u00a0acquaintance or extended family member over the festive season, she said it was important to be up-front and clear.\u00a0", "\"Just speak really plainly in a reasonable tone about the rules and maybe not get into arguments,\" she said.", "\"I imagine there'll be all sorts of conversations and all sorts of worries and uncertainties, but I think trying to keep calm \u2026 believing that things will get easier \u2026 down the track as we get a bit of rehearsal at some of this stuff.\"", "", "
Dr\u00a0Stow recommended\u00a0reminding kids about the upside of borders opening.(Unsplash: Jude Beck)
", "She also recommended\u00a0keeping children in the loop.", "\"Talking to kids is so, so important, keeping them in the family loop,\" she said.", "\"It's important that they feel informed and talking with them at a language level that's appropriate, reminding them of the rules and reminding them how it's important that we all work together to try [to]\u00a0keep each other safe.\"", "It is also recommended to highlight the exciting side of borders opening, like seeing family and friends again.", "\"Just highlighting the joy, but reminding them that the other side of it is to stay well and also reassure them that parents, that the people around them, have got their best interests at heart.\"\u00a0", "", "
